Request      

PATCH api/admin/orders/{id}/restore

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the soft deleted order to restore. Example: 43

Payment Processing

Create or retrieve payment intent

requires authentication

Creates a new Stripe PaymentIntent for the specified order, or returns an existing one if already created. This prevents duplicate payment intents for the same order. The client secret returned should be used on the frontend to complete the payment with Stripe's client-side libraries.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/create" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"order_id\": 123
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/create"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "order_id": 123
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/create';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'order_id' => 123,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/create'
payload = {
    "order_id": 123
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, New PaymentIntent created):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "PaymentIntent created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "client_secret": "pi_1234567890abcdef_secret_xyz789abc123"
    }
}

Example response (200, Existing PaymentIntent retrieved):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Existing PaymentIntent retrieved.",
    "data": {
        "client_secret": "pi_1234567890abcdef_secret_xyz789abc123"
    }
}

Example response (200, Order already paid):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Payment has already been processed for this order.",
    "data": null
}

Example response (400, Unsupported gateway):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Unsupported payment gateway",
    "data": null
}

Example response (400, Order not eligible for payment):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Order has already been paid or is not in a payable state.",
    "data": null
}

Example response (404, Order not found):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Order] 999",
    "data": null
}

Example response (422, Invalid order data):


{
    "errors": [
        "The order id field is required.",
        "The order id must be an integer.",
        "The selected order id is invalid."
    ]
}

Example response (500, Stripe API error):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Unable to create payment intent with Stripe. Please try again.",
    "data": null
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/payments/{gateway}/create

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

gateway   string   

The payment gateway to use. Currently only "stripe" is supported. Example: stripe

Body Parameters

order_id   integer   

The ID of the order to create payment for. Must be a valid, unpaid order. Example: 123

Verify payment status

requires authentication

Manually verifies the status of a payment with Stripe and updates the local database accordingly. This is useful for handling cases where webhooks might have failed or been delayed. It fetches the latest payment status directly from Stripe and synchronizes it with your database.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/verify" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"payment_intent_id\": \"pi_1234567890abcdef\",
    \"order_id\": 123
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/verify"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "payment_intent_id": "pi_1234567890abcdef",
    "order_id": 123
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/verify';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'payment_intent_id' => 'pi_1234567890abcdef',
            'order_id' => 123,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/payments/stripe/verify'
payload = {
    "payment_intent_id": "pi_1234567890abcdef",
    "order_id": 123
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Payment verified as successful):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Payment verified",
    "data": {
        "payment_status": "Paid",
        "order_status": "Confirmed"
    }
}

Example response (200, Payment still pending):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Payment verified",
    "data": {
        "payment_status": "Pending",
        "order_status": "Pending Payment"
    }
}

Example response (200, Payment failed):


{
    "status": true,
    "message": "Payment verified",
    "data": {
        "payment_status": "Failed",
        "order_status": "Failed"
    }
}

Example response (400, Unsupported gateway):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Unsupported payment gateway",
    "data": null
}

Example response (400, Payment amount mismatch):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Payment amount mismatch",
    "data": null
}

Example response (404, Payment not found in database):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Payment not found",
    "data": null
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The payment intent id field is required.",
        "The payment intent id format is invalid. Must be a valid Stripe payment intent ID.",
        "The order id field is required.",
        "The selected order id is invalid."
    ]
}

Example response (500, Stripe API error):


{
    "status": false,
    "message": "Unable to retrieve payment from Stripe: No such payment_intent: 'pi_invalid'",
    "data": null
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/payments/{gateway}/verify

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

gateway   string   

The payment gateway used. Currently only "stripe" is supported. Example: stripe

Body Parameters

payment_intent_id   string   

The Stripe PaymentIntent ID to verify. Must be a valid Stripe PaymentIntent ID format. Example: pi_1234567890abcdef

order_id   integer   

The ID of the order associated with this payment for verification. Example: 123

Refund Management

Retrieve a paginated list of all refund records

requires authentication

Get a comprehensive list of all refunds processed in the system with detailed information about amounts, statuses, associated orders, and processing details. This endpoint is essential for financial reporting, refund tracking, customer service, and administrative oversight of refund operations. Includes complete audit trail for each refund transaction.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds?page=2&per_page=25&status=Refunded&date_from=2025-01-01&date_to=2025-01-31&order_id=45&user_id=123&amount_min=10.00&amount_max=500.00" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds"
);

const params = {
    "page": "2",
    "per_page": "25",
    "status": "Refunded",
    "date_from": "2025-01-01",
    "date_to": "2025-01-31",
    "order_id": "45",
    "user_id": "123",
    "amount_min": "10.00",
    "amount_max": "500.00",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'page' => '2',
            'per_page' => '25',
            'status' => 'Refunded',
            'date_from' => '2025-01-01',
            'date_to' => '2025-01-31',
            'order_id' => '45',
            'user_id' => '123',
            'amount_min' => '10.00',
            'amount_max' => '500.00',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds'
params = {
  'page': '2',
  'per_page': '25',
  'status': 'Refunded',
  'date_from': '2025-01-01',
  'date_to': '2025-01-31',
  'order_id': '45',
  'user_id': '123',
  'amount_min': '10.00',
  'amount_max': '500.00',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Refunds retrieved successfully):

    "message": "Refunds retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [

        "prev_page_url": null
    }

Example response (200, No refunds found):


{
    "message": "Refunds retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 20,
        "total": 0,
        "last_page": 1,
        "from": null,
        "to": null
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Invalid filter parameters):


{
    "errors": [
        "The status field must be one of: Pending, Processing, Refunded, Partially Refunded, Failed, Cancelled, Declined.",
        "The date from field must be a valid date in YYYY-MM-DD format.",
        "The amount min field must be a number greater than 0.",
        "The order id field must be an integer."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/refunds

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of refunds per page (max 100). Default: 20. Example: 25

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by refund status. Available: Pending, Processing, Refunded, Partially Refunded, Failed, Cancelled, Declined. Example: Refunded

date_from   string  optional  

optional Filter refunds from this date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Example: 2025-01-01

date_to   string  optional  

optional Filter refunds to this date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Example: 2025-01-31

order_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter refunds by specific order ID. Example: 45

user_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter refunds by specific customer ID. Example: 123

amount_min   string  optional  

numeric optional Filter refunds with minimum amount in pounds. Example: 10.00

amount_max   string  optional  

numeric optional Filter refunds with maximum amount in pounds. Example: 500.00

Admin Review Management

Get all reviews with admin filtering capabilities

requires authentication

Retrieve all reviews in the system with advanced admin filtering and sorting. Provides comprehensive review management including pending approvals, reported reviews, and detailed analytics for administrative oversight.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews?product_id=15&user_id=45&rating[]=1&rating[]=2&status=pending&is_featured=1&is_verified=1&has_reports=1&sort_by=reports_count&per_page=50&page=2" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"product_id\": 16,
    \"rating\": [
        2
    ],
    \"verified_only\": false,
    \"with_media\": true,
    \"sort_by\": \"helpful\",
    \"per_page\": 1,
    \"page\": 66
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews"
);

const params = {
    "product_id": "15",
    "user_id": "45",
    "rating[0]": "1",
    "rating[1]": "2",
    "status": "pending",
    "is_featured": "1",
    "is_verified": "1",
    "has_reports": "1",
    "sort_by": "reports_count",
    "per_page": "50",
    "page": "2",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "product_id": 16,
    "rating": [
        2
    ],
    "verified_only": false,
    "with_media": true,
    "sort_by": "helpful",
    "per_page": 1,
    "page": 66
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'product_id' => '15',
            'user_id' => '45',
            'rating[0]' => '1',
            'rating[1]' => '2',
            'status' => 'pending',
            'is_featured' => '1',
            'is_verified' => '1',
            'has_reports' => '1',
            'sort_by' => 'reports_count',
            'per_page' => '50',
            'page' => '2',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'product_id' => 16,
            'rating' => [
                2,
            ],
            'verified_only' => false,
            'with_media' => true,
            'sort_by' => 'helpful',
            'per_page' => 1,
            'page' => 66,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews'
payload = {
    "product_id": 16,
    "rating": [
        2
    ],
    "verified_only": false,
    "with_media": true,
    "sort_by": "helpful",
    "per_page": 1,
    "page": 66
}
params = {
  'product_id': '15',
  'user_id': '45',
  'rating[0]': '1',
  'rating[1]': '2',
  'status': 'pending',
  'is_featured': '1',
  'is_verified': '1',
  'has_reports': '1',
  'sort_by': 'reports_count',
  'per_page': '50',
  'page': '2',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, json=payload, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Reviews retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Reviews retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 123,
                "user": {
                    "id": 45,
                    "name": "Sarah Johnson",
                    "email": "sarah.johnson@example.com"
                },
                "product": {
                    "id": 15,
                    "name": "Premium Wireless Earbuds"
                },
                "rating": 5,
                "title": "Excellent sound quality!",
                "content": "These earbuds exceeded my expectations...",
                "is_verified_purchase": true,
                "is_featured": false,
                "is_approved": true,
                "helpful_votes": 12,
                "total_votes": 15,
                "reports_count": 0,
                "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:30:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 20,
        "total": 1543,
        "last_page": 78
    },
    "meta": {
        "stats": {
            "total_reviews": 1543,
            "pending_approval": 23,
            "reported_reviews": 8,
            "featured_reviews": 45,
            "average_rating": 4.2
        }
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/reviews

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

product_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by specific product ID. Example: 15

user_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by specific user ID. Example: 45

rating   string[]  optional  

optional Filter by specific ratings (1-5).

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by approval status. Options: approved, pending, rejected. Example: pending

is_featured   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by featured status. Example: true

is_verified   boolean  optional  

optional Filter by verified purchase status. Example: true

has_reports   boolean  optional  

optional Filter reviews that have been reported. Example: true

sort_by   string  optional  

optional Sort reviews. Options: newest, oldest, rating_high, rating_low, reports_count. Example: reports_count

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of reviews per page (1-100). Default: 20. Example: 50

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

Body Parameters

product_id   integer  optional  

The id of an existing record in the products table. Example: 16

rating   integer[]  optional  

Must be between 1 and 5.

verified_only   boolean  optional  

Example: false

with_media   boolean  optional  

Example: true

sort_by   string  optional  

Example: helpful

Must be one of:
  • newest
  • oldest
  • rating_high
  • rating_low
  • helpful
per_page   integer  optional  

Must be between 1 and 50. Example: 1

page   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Example: 66

Get detailed review information for admin

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive admin view of a specific review including all reports, moderation history, user details, and administrative actions available.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

                "id": 67,

        "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:30:00.000000Z"

Request      

GET api/admin/reviews/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to retrieve. Example: 123

Delete a review permanently

requires authentication

Permanently delete a review and all associated data including media files, helpfulness votes, and reports. This action is irreversible.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Review deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Review deleted permanently."
}

{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Review] 999"
}

Request      

DELETE api/admin/reviews/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to delete permanently. Example: 123

Moderate a review (approve, reject, feature, unfeature)

requires authentication

Perform moderation actions on reviews including approval, rejection, featuring, and unfeaturing. All actions are logged for audit trail and accountability.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16/moderate" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"action\": \"approve\",
    \"reason\": \"\\\"Contains inappropriate language\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16/moderate"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "action": "approve",
    "reason": "\"Contains inappropriate language\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16/moderate';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'action' => 'approve',
            'reason' => '"Contains inappropriate language"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/16/moderate'
payload = {
    "action": "approve",
    "reason": "\"Contains inappropriate language\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Review moderated successfully):


{
    "message": "Review approved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "action": "approve",
        "is_approved": true,
        "is_featured": false,
        "moderated_by": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Admin User"
        },
        "moderated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "reason": null
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "Reason is required when rejecting a review.",
        "Invalid moderation action."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/reviews/{review_id}/moderate

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

review_id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to moderate. Example: 123

Body Parameters

action   string   

Moderation action to perform. Options: approve, reject, feature, unfeature. Example: approve

reason   string  optional  

optional Reason for the action (required for reject). Example: "Contains inappropriate language"

Bulk moderate multiple reviews

requires authentication

Perform the same moderation action on multiple reviews simultaneously. Useful for bulk approval, rejection, or featuring of reviews.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/bulk-moderate" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"review_ids\": [
        123,
        124,
        125
    ],
    \"action\": \"approve\",
    \"reason\": \"\\\"Quality assurance batch approval\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/bulk-moderate"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "review_ids": [
        123,
        124,
        125
    ],
    "action": "approve",
    "reason": "\"Quality assurance batch approval\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/bulk-moderate';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'review_ids' => [
                123,
                124,
                125,
            ],
            'action' => 'approve',
            'reason' => '"Quality assurance batch approval"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/bulk-moderate'
payload = {
    "review_ids": [
        123,
        124,
        125
    ],
    "action": "approve",
    "reason": "\"Quality assurance batch approval\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Bulk moderation completed):


{
    "message": "Bulk moderation completed successfully.",
    "data": {
        "action": "approve",
        "total_reviews": 3,
        "successful": 3,
        "failed": 0,
        "results": [
            {
                "review_id": 123,
                "status": "success",
                "message": "Review approved"
            },
            {
                "review_id": 124,
                "status": "success",
                "message": "Review approved"
            },
            {
                "review_id": 125,
                "status": "success",
                "message": "Review approved"
            }
        ],
        "moderated_by": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Admin User"
        },
        "moderated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The review_ids field is required.",
        "The action field is required."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/reviews/bulk-moderate

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

review_ids   string[]   

Array of review IDs to moderate.

action   string   

Bulk action to perform. Options: approve, reject, feature, unfeature. Example: approve

reason   string  optional  

optional Reason for bulk action (required for reject). Example: "Quality assurance batch approval"

Get all reported reviews for moderation

requires authentication

Retrieve all reviews that have been reported by users, sorted by priority and report severity. Essential for content moderation workflow.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports?status=pending&reason=spam&priority=high&sort_by=reports_count&per_page=50" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports"
);

const params = {
    "status": "pending",
    "reason": "spam",
    "priority": "high",
    "sort_by": "reports_count",
    "per_page": "50",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'status' => 'pending',
            'reason' => 'spam',
            'priority' => 'high',
            'sort_by' => 'reports_count',
            'per_page' => '50',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports'
params = {
  'status': 'pending',
  'reason': 'spam',
  'priority': 'high',
  'sort_by': 'reports_count',
  'per_page': '50',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

                "last_reported_at": "2025-01-13T08:15:00.000000Z"

        "per_page": 20,
        "total": 47

Request      

GET api/admin/reviews/reports

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by report status. Options: pending, reviewed, resolved, dismissed. Default: pending. Example: pending

reason   string  optional  

optional Filter by report reason. Options: spam, inappropriate_language, fake_review, off_topic, personal_information, other. Example: spam

priority   string  optional  

optional Filter by priority level. Options: high, medium, low. Example: high

sort_by   string  optional  

optional Sort reports. Options: newest, oldest, priority, reports_count. Default: priority. Example: reports_count

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of reports per page (1-100). Default: 20. Example: 50

Handle a review report (resolve, dismiss)

requires authentication

Take action on review reports by resolving or dismissing them. Resolved reports indicate action was taken, dismissed reports indicate the report was invalid or not actionable.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports/16/handle" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"action\": \"resolve\",
    \"notes\": \"\\\"Review content violates community guidelines\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports/16/handle"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "action": "resolve",
    "notes": "\"Review content violates community guidelines\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports/16/handle';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'action' => 'resolve',
            'notes' => '"Review content violates community guidelines"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/reports/16/handle'
payload = {
    "action": "resolve",
    "notes": "\"Review content violates community guidelines\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Report handled successfully):


{
    "message": "Review report resolved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "report_id": 67,
        "review_id": 123,
        "action": "resolve",
        "status": "resolved",
        "admin_notes": "Review content violates community guidelines",
        "reviewed_by": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Admin User"
        },
        "reviewed_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ReviewReport] 999"
}

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/reviews/reports/{report_id}/handle

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

report_id   integer   

The ID of the report. Example: 16

report   integer   

The ID of the review report to handle. Example: 67

Body Parameters

action   string   

Action to take on the report. Options: resolve, dismiss. Example: resolve

notes   string  optional  

optional Admin notes explaining the decision. Example: "Review content violates community guidelines"

Get review analytics and statistics

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive analytics about reviews including trends, moderation statistics, and quality metrics for administrative insights.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/analytics?period=week&product_id=15&include_trends=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/analytics"
);

const params = {
    "period": "week",
    "product_id": "15",
    "include_trends": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/reviews/analytics';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'period' => 'week',
            'product_id' => '15',
            'include_trends' => '1',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Request      

GET api/admin/reviews/analytics

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

period   string  optional  

optional Time period for analytics. Options: today, week, month, quarter, year. Default: month. Example: week

product_id   integer  optional  

optional Get analytics for specific product. Example: 15

include_trends   boolean  optional  

optional Include trend data and charts. Default: false. Example: true

Admin Review Response Management

Get all review responses with admin filtering capabilities

requires authentication

Retrieve all vendor responses in the system with advanced admin filtering and sorting. Provides comprehensive response management including pending approvals, response analytics, and detailed oversight for administrative purposes.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses?vendor_id=5&product_id=15&review_rating[]=4&review_rating[]=5&status=pending&sort_by=newest&per_page=50&page=2" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses"
);

const params = {
    "vendor_id": "5",
    "product_id": "15",
    "review_rating[0]": "4",
    "review_rating[1]": "5",
    "status": "pending",
    "sort_by": "newest",
    "per_page": "50",
    "page": "2",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'vendor_id' => '5',
            'product_id' => '15',
            'review_rating[0]' => '4',
            'review_rating[1]' => '5',
            'status' => 'pending',
            'sort_by' => 'newest',
            'per_page' => '50',
            'page' => '2',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

import json

  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'

response.json()

Request      

GET api/admin/review-responses

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

vendor_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by specific vendor ID. Example: 5

product_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter by specific product ID. Example: 15

review_rating   string[]  optional  

optional Filter by review ratings (1-5).

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by approval status. Options: approved, pending, rejected. Example: pending

sort_by   string  optional  

optional Sort responses. Options: newest, oldest, rating_high, rating_low. Example: newest

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of responses per page (1-100). Default: 20. Example: 50

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

Get detailed review response information for admin

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive admin view of a specific vendor response including review context, vendor details, approval status, and administrative actions available.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());

$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16';

    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);

        "created_at": "2025-01-14T16:45:00.000000Z",

Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/review-responses/{response_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

response_id   integer   

The ID of the response. Example: 16

response   integer   

The ID of the response to retrieve. Example: 45

Approve a vendor response

requires authentication

Approve a pending vendor response, making it visible to customers. Only responses that are currently unapproved can be approved through this endpoint.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16/approve" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16/approve"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16/approve';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16/approve'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Response approved successfully):


{
    "message": "Response approved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 45,
        "is_approved": true,
        "approved_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "approved_by": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Admin User"
        }
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (409, Already approved):


{
    "message": "Response is already approved."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

POST api/admin/review-responses/{response_id}/approve

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

response_id   integer   

The ID of the response. Example: 16

response   integer   

The ID of the response to approve. Example: 45

Delete a vendor response permanently

requires authentication

Permanently delete a vendor response. This action is irreversible and will remove the response from the review thread completely.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Response deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Response deleted permanently."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Response not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ReviewResponse] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/review-responses/{response_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

response_id   integer   

The ID of the response. Example: 16

response   integer   

The ID of the response to delete permanently. Example: 45

Bulk moderate multiple vendor responses

requires authentication

Perform the same moderation action on multiple vendor responses simultaneously. Useful for bulk approval, rejection, or deletion of responses.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/bulk-moderate" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"response_ids\": [
        45,
        46,
        47
    ],
    \"action\": \"approve\",
    \"reason\": \"\\\"Quality assurance batch approval\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/bulk-moderate"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "response_ids": [
        45,
        46,
        47
    ],
    "action": "approve",
    "reason": "\"Quality assurance batch approval\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/bulk-moderate';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'response_ids' => [
                45,
                46,
                47,
            ],
            'action' => 'approve',
            'reason' => '"Quality assurance batch approval"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/bulk-moderate'
payload = {
    "response_ids": [
        45,
        46,
        47
    ],
    "action": "approve",
    "reason": "\"Quality assurance batch approval\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Bulk moderation completed):


{
    "message": "Bulk moderation completed successfully.",
    "data": {
        "action": "approve",
        "total_responses": 3,
        "successful": 3,
        "failed": 0,
        "results": [
            {
                "response_id": 45,
                "status": "success",
                "message": "Approved successfully"
            },
            {
                "response_id": 46,
                "status": "success",
                "message": "Approved successfully"
            },
            {
                "response_id": 47,
                "status": "success",
                "message": "Approved successfully"
            }
        ],
        "moderated_by": {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "Admin User"
        },
        "moderated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The response_ids field is required.",
        "The action field is required."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/review-responses/bulk-moderate

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

response_ids   string[]   

Array of response IDs to moderate.

action   string   

Bulk action to perform. Options: approve, reject, delete. Example: approve

reason   string  optional  

optional Reason for bulk action (recommended for reject/delete). Example: "Quality assurance batch approval"

Get review response analytics and statistics

requires authentication

Retrieve comprehensive analytics about vendor responses including response rates, approval statistics, vendor performance metrics, and trends for administrative insights.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/analytics?period=week&vendor_id=8&include_trends=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/analytics"
);

const params = {
    "period": "week",
    "vendor_id": "8",
    "include_trends": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/analytics';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'period' => 'week',
            'vendor_id' => '8',
            'include_trends' => '1',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/review-responses/analytics'
params = {
  'period': 'week',
  'vendor_id': '8',
  'include_trends': '1',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Analytics retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Response analytics retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "summary": {
            "total_responses": 156,
            "pending_approval": 12,
            "approved_responses": 144,
            "response_rate": 73.2,
            "average_response_time_hours": 6.4
        },
        "period_stats": {
            "new_responses": 23,
            "approved_responses": 21,
            "rejected_responses": 1
        },
        "top_vendors": [
            {
                "vendor_id": 8,
                "vendor_name": "Tech Solutions Inc",
                "response_count": 45,
                "response_rate": 89.5,
                "average_response_time": 4.2
            },
            {
                "vendor_id": 12,
                "vendor_name": "Premium Electronics",
                "response_count": 32,
                "response_rate": 78.3,
                "average_response_time": 8.1
            }
        ],
        "response_trends": {
            "daily_responses": [
                {
                    "date": "2025-01-10",
                    "responses": 8
                },
                {
                    "date": "2025-01-11",
                    "responses": 12
                },
                {
                    "date": "2025-01-12",
                    "responses": 6
                }
            ]
        }
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/review-responses/analytics

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

period   string  optional  

optional Time period for analytics. Options: today, week, month, quarter, year. Default: month. Example: week

vendor_id   integer  optional  

optional Get analytics for specific vendor. Example: 8

include_trends   boolean  optional  

optional Include trend data and charts. Default: false. Example: true

Inventory Management

Get inventory overview

requires authentication

Returns low stock and out of stock items for admin dashboard. Provides a complete overview of inventory status for immediate action.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/overview" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/overview"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/overview';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/overview'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Inventory overview retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Inventory overview retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "low_stock_items": [
            {
                "type": "product",
                "id": 15,
                "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones",
                "current_stock": 8,
                "threshold": 10,
                "vendor": "AudioTech Solutions"
            },
            {
                "type": "variant",
                "id": 24,
                "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones - Color: White",
                "current_stock": 3,
                "threshold": 5,
                "vendor": "AudioTech Solutions"
            }
        ],
        "out_of_stock_items": [
            {
                "type": "product",
                "id": 22,
                "name": "USB-C Cable",
                "vendor": "TechCorp"
            }
        ],
        "summary": {
            "low_stock_count": 2,
            "out_of_stock_count": 1,
            "total_issues": 3
        }
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Update product stock threshold

requires authentication

Updates the low stock threshold for a specific product. When the product's quantity falls to or below this threshold, alerts will be triggered.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/products/1/threshold" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"low_stock_threshold\": 15
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/products/1/threshold"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "low_stock_threshold": 15
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/products/1/threshold';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'low_stock_threshold' => 15,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/products/1/threshold'
payload = {
    "low_stock_threshold": 15
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product threshold updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Product stock threshold updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 15,
        "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones",
        "current_stock": 25,
        "old_threshold": 10,
        "new_threshold": 15
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Product not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Product] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The low stock threshold field is required.",
        "The low stock threshold must be at least 0."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/inventory/products/{product_id}/threshold

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

product_id   integer   

The ID of the product. Example: 1

product   integer   

The ID of the product to update. Example: 15

Body Parameters

low_stock_threshold   integer   

The new threshold value (minimum 0). Example: 15

Update variant stock threshold

requires authentication

Updates the low stock threshold for a specific product variant. When the variant's quantity falls to or below this threshold, alerts will be triggered.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/variants/1/threshold" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"low_stock_threshold\": 8
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/variants/1/threshold"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "low_stock_threshold": 8
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/inventory/variants/1/threshold';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'low_stock_threshold' => 8,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

payload = {
    "low_stock_threshold": 8
}

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response.json()

    "message": "Variant stock threshold updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 24,
        "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones - Color: White",
        "current_stock": 20,
        "old_threshold": 5,
        "new_threshold": 8
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Variant not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ProductVariant] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The low stock threshold field is required.",
        "The low stock threshold must be at least 0."
    ]
}
