Request      

GET api/admin/product-categories

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Store a new product category

requires authentication

Create a new product category in the system. Categories can be created as top-level categories (with no parent) or as subcategories under existing categories. This hierarchical structure helps organize products for better navigation and filtering. Category names must be unique across the entire system to avoid confusion.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"Laptops\\\"\",
    \"parent_id\": 1
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"Laptops\"",
    "parent_id": 1
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"Laptops"',
            'parent_id' => 1,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories'
payload = {
    "name": "\"Laptops\"",
    "parent_id": 1
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Category created successfully):


{
    "message": "Category created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 10,
        "name": "Laptops",
        "parent_id": 1,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (200, Top-level category created):


{
    "message": "Category created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 11,
        "name": "Home & Garden",
        "parent_id": null,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:35:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:35:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The parent id must exist in product_categories table.",
        "The name may not be greater than 255 characters."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Duplicate category name):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Invalid parent category):


{
    "errors": [
        "The selected parent id is invalid."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-categories

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

name   string   

The name of the category. Must be unique across all categories. Example: "Laptops"

parent_id   integer  optional  

optional The ID of the parent category. Omit for top-level categories. Example: 1

Get a specific product category

requires authentication

Retrieve detailed information about a specific product category including its subcategories. This endpoint is useful for examining category hierarchies and understanding the structure of product organization within a particular category branch.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Request      

GET api/admin/product-categories/{productCategory_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productCategory_id   integer   

The ID of the productCategory. Example: 1

productCategory   integer   

The ID of the product category to retrieve. Example: 1

Update a product category

requires authentication

Modify an existing product category's name or parent relationship. When changing the parent, ensure that circular references are not created (a category cannot be its own ancestor). The system prevents self-referencing to maintain a valid hierarchical structure.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"Updated Category Name\\\"\",
    \"parent_id\": 2
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"Updated Category Name\"",
    "parent_id": 2
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"Updated Category Name"',
            'parent_id' => 2,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1'
payload = {
    "name": "\"Updated Category Name\"",
    "parent_id": 2
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Category updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Category updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 10,
        "name": "Updated Category Name",
        "parent_id": 2,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:45:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (200, Category made top-level):


{
    "message": "Category updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 10,
        "name": "Independent Category",
        "parent_id": null,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:50:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Category not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ProductCategory] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The parent id must exist in product_categories table.",
        "The parent id field cannot reference the current category (self-reference not allowed)."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Self-reference attempt):


{
    "errors": [
        "A category cannot be its own parent."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Circular reference prevention):


{
    "errors": [
        "Cannot set parent category as it would create a circular reference in the hierarchy."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-categories/{productCategory_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productCategory_id   integer   

The ID of the productCategory. Example: 1

productCategory   integer   

The ID of the product category to update. Example: 10

Body Parameters

name   string   

The updated name of the category. Must be unique across all categories. Example: "Updated Category Name"

parent_id   integer  optional  

optional The ID of the parent category. Cannot be the same as the category being updated. Example: 2

Delete a product category

requires authentication

Permanently remove a product category from the system. Categories can only be deleted if they have no subcategories (children). If a category contains subcategories, those must be deleted first or moved to another parent category. This prevents orphaned categories and maintains the integrity of the hierarchical structure.

Warning: Deleting a category may affect products that are currently assigned to it. Ensure products are reassigned to appropriate categories before deletion.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-categories/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Category deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Category deleted successfully"
}

Example response (400, Category has subcategories):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete a category with subcategories"
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Category not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ProductCategory] 999"
}

Example response (409, Category has associated products):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete category that has products assigned to it. Please reassign products to other categories first."
}

Example response (422, Category has dependencies):


{
    "message": "This category cannot be deleted as it has associated products or subcategories."
}

Example response (500, Deletion failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while deleting the category."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/product-categories/{productCategory_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productCategory_id   integer   

The ID of the productCategory. Example: 1

productCategory   integer   

The ID of the product category to delete. Example: 10

Product Reviews

Get reviews for a specific product with filtering and sorting

Retrieve all approved reviews for a product with advanced filtering capabilities. Supports filtering by rating, verified purchases, media presence, and various sorting options. Essential for product detail pages and review browsing functionality.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/products/1/reviews?rating[]=4&rating[]=5&verified_only=1&with_media=1&sort_by=helpful&per_page=20&page=2" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"product_id\": 16,
    \"rating\": [
        2
    ],
    \"verified_only\": true,
    \"with_media\": true,
    \"sort_by\": \"oldest\",
    \"per_page\": 1,
    \"page\": 66
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/products/1/reviews"
);

const params = {
    "rating[0]": "4",
    "rating[1]": "5",
    "verified_only": "1",
    "with_media": "1",
    "sort_by": "helpful",
    "per_page": "20",
    "page": "2",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "product_id": 16,
    "rating": [
        2
    ],
    "verified_only": true,
    "with_media": true,
    "sort_by": "oldest",
    "per_page": 1,
    "page": 66
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/products/1/reviews';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'rating[0]' => '4',
            'rating[1]' => '5',
            'verified_only' => '1',
            'with_media' => '1',
            'sort_by' => 'helpful',
            'per_page' => '20',
            'page' => '2',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'product_id' => 16,
            'rating' => [
                2,
            ],
            'verified_only' => true,
            'with_media' => true,
            'sort_by' => 'oldest',
            'per_page' => 1,
            'page' => 66,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/products/1/reviews'
payload = {
    "product_id": 16,
    "rating": [
        2
    ],
    "verified_only": true,
    "with_media": true,
    "sort_by": "oldest",
    "per_page": 1,
    "page": 66
}
params = {
  'rating[0]': '4',
  'rating[1]': '5',
  'verified_only': '1',
  'with_media': '1',
  'sort_by': 'helpful',
  'per_page': '20',
  'page': '2',
}
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, json=payload, params=params)
response.json()

Example response (200, Reviews retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Product reviews retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "data": [
            {
                "id": 123,
                "user": {
                    "id": 45,
                    "name": "Sarah Johnson",
                    "email": "s***@example.com"
                },
                "product": {
                    "id": 15,
                    "name": "Premium Wireless Earbuds",
                    "price_formatted": "£89.99"
                },
                "rating": 5,
                "title": "Excellent sound quality!",
                "content": "These earbuds exceeded my expectations. The noise cancellation is fantastic and battery life is exactly as advertised.",
                "is_verified_purchase": true,
                "is_featured": false,
                "helpful_votes": 12,
                "total_votes": 15,
                "helpfulness_ratio": 80,
                "user_voted": null,
                "media": [
                    {
                        "id": 67,
                        "media_type": "image",
                        "url": "https://yourapi.com/storage/reviews/review-image-1.jpg",
                        "thumbnail_url": "https://yourapi.com/storage/reviews/thumb_review-image-1.jpg"
                    }
                ],
                "response": null,
                "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:30:00.000000Z",
                "can_edit": false,
                "can_delete": false
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 15,
        "total": 127,
        "last_page": 9
    },
    "meta": {
        "product_id": 15,
        "total_reviews": 127,
        "average_rating": 4.3,
        "rating_breakdown": {
            "1": 2,
            "2": 8,
            "3": 15,
            "4": 45,
            "5": 57
        },
        "verified_purchase_count": 89,
        "with_media_count": 34
    }
}

Example response (404, Product not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Product] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/products/{product_id}/reviews

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

product_id   integer   

The ID of the product. Example: 1

product   integer   

The ID of the product to get reviews for. Example: 15

Query Parameters

rating   string[]  optional  

optional Filter by specific ratings (1-5). Can be multiple values.

verified_only   boolean  optional  

optional Show only verified purchase reviews. Default: false. Example: true

with_media   boolean  optional  

optional Show only reviews with photos/videos. Default: false. Example: true

sort_by   string  optional  

optional Sort reviews. Options: newest, oldest, rating_high, rating_low, helpful. Default: newest. Example: helpful

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of reviews per page (1-50). Default: 15. Example: 20

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

Body Parameters

product_id   integer  optional  

The id of an existing record in the products table. Example: 16

rating   integer[]  optional  

Must be between 1 and 5.

verified_only   boolean  optional  

Example: true

with_media   boolean  optional  

Example: true

sort_by   string  optional  

Example: oldest

Must be one of:
  • newest
  • oldest
  • rating_high
  • rating_low
  • helpful
per_page   integer  optional  

Must be between 1 and 50. Example: 1

page   integer  optional  

Must be at least 1. Example: 66

Get detailed information about a specific review

Retrieve comprehensive details about a single review including user information, media attachments, helpfulness votes, and vendor responses if available.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16'
headers = {
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Review retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Review retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "user": {
            "id": 45,
            "name": "Sarah Johnson",
            "email": "s***@example.com"
        },
        "product": {
            "id": 15,
            "name": "Premium Wireless Earbuds",
            "price_formatted": "£89.99",
            "featured_image": "https://yourapi.com/storage/products/featured-image.jpg"
        },
        "rating": 5,
        "title": "Excellent sound quality!",
        "content": "These earbuds exceeded my expectations...",
        "is_verified_purchase": true,
        "is_featured": false,
        "helpful_votes": 12,
        "total_votes": 15,
        "helpfulness_ratio": 80,
        "user_voted": null,
        "media": [],
        "response": null,
        "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "can_edit": false,
        "can_delete": false
    }
}

Example response (404, Review not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Review] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/reviews/{id}

Headers

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to retrieve. Example: 123

Create a new product review

requires authentication

Submit a new review for a product. Users can only review products they have purchased and can only submit one review per product. Supports uploading media files (images/videos) with the review for enhanced credibility.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "product_id=15"\
    --form "order_item_id=234"\
    --form "rating=5"\
    --form "title="Excellent sound quality!""\
    --form "content="These earbuds exceeded my expectations...""\
    --form "media[]=@/tmp/phpAQVFhp" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('product_id', '15');
body.append('order_item_id', '234');
body.append('rating', '5');
body.append('title', '"Excellent sound quality!"');
body.append('content', '"These earbuds exceeded my expectations..."');
body.append('media[]', document.querySelector('input[name="media[]"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'multipart/form-data',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'multipart' => [
            [
                'name' => 'product_id',
                'contents' => '15'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'order_item_id',
                'contents' => '234'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'rating',
                'contents' => '5'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'title',
                'contents' => '"Excellent sound quality!"'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'content',
                'contents' => '"These earbuds exceeded my expectations..."'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'media[]',
                'contents' => fopen('/tmp/phpAQVFhp', 'r')
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews'
files = {
  'product_id': (None, '15'),
  'order_item_id': (None, '234'),
  'rating': (None, '5'),
  'title': (None, '"Excellent sound quality!"'),
  'content': (None, '"These earbuds exceeded my expectations..."'),
  'media[]': open('/tmp/phpAQVFhp', 'rb')}
payload = {
    "product_id": 15,
    "order_item_id": 234,
    "rating": 5,
    "title": "\"Excellent sound quality!\"",
    "content": "\"These earbuds exceeded my expectations...\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'multipart/form-data',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, files=files)
response.json()

Example response (201, Review created successfully):


{
    "message": "Review submitted successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "user": {
            "id": 45,
            "name": "Sarah Johnson"
        },
        "product": {
            "id": 15,
            "name": "Premium Wireless Earbuds"
        },
        "rating": 5,
        "title": "Excellent sound quality!",
        "content": "These earbuds exceeded my expectations...",
        "is_verified_purchase": true,
        "is_featured": false,
        "helpful_votes": 0,
        "total_votes": 0,
        "media": [],
        "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Cannot review product):


{
    "message": "You can only review products you have purchased."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "You have already reviewed this product.",
        "Rating must be between 1 and 5 stars.",
        "Review content must be at least 10 characters long."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/reviews

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

product_id   integer   

The ID of the product being reviewed. Example: 15

order_item_id   integer  optional  

optional The order item ID for verified purchase reviews. Example: 234

rating   integer   

Rating from 1-5 stars. Example: 5

title   string  optional  

optional Short review title (3-255 characters). Example: "Excellent sound quality!"

content   string   

Detailed review content (10-2000 characters). Example: "These earbuds exceeded my expectations..."

media   file[]  optional  

optional Upload images or videos with review (max 5 files, 10MB each).
*   object  optional  
file   file  optional  

Photo or video file (jpg, jpeg, png, gif, mp4, mov, avi). Example: /tmp/phps15oXd

Update an existing review

requires authentication

Update your own review within the allowed time window (30 days after creation). You can modify the rating, title, content, and add/remove media attachments.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --form "rating=4"\
    --form "title="Good sound quality""\
    --form "content="Updated thoughts on these earbuds...""\
    --form "remove_media[]=67"\
    --form "media[]=@/tmp/phpzh4Yfx" 
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "multipart/form-data",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

const body = new FormData();
body.append('rating', '4');
body.append('title', '"Good sound quality"');
body.append('content', '"Updated thoughts on these earbuds..."');
body.append('remove_media[]', '67');
body.append('media[]', document.querySelector('input[name="media[]"]').files[0]);

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'multipart/form-data',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'multipart' => [
            [
                'name' => 'rating',
                'contents' => '4'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'title',
                'contents' => '"Good sound quality"'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'content',
                'contents' => '"Updated thoughts on these earbuds..."'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'remove_media[]',
                'contents' => '67'
            ],
            [
                'name' => 'media[]',
                'contents' => fopen('/tmp/phpzh4Yfx', 'r')
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16'
files = {
  'rating': (None, '4'),
  'title': (None, '"Good sound quality"'),
  'content': (None, '"Updated thoughts on these earbuds..."'),
  'remove_media[]': (None, '67'),
  'media[]': open('/tmp/phpzh4Yfx', 'rb')}
payload = {
    "rating": 4,
    "title": "\"Good sound quality\"",
    "content": "\"Updated thoughts on these earbuds...\"",
    "remove_media": [
        67,
        68
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'multipart/form-data',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, files=files)
response.json()

Example response (200, Review updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Review updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "rating": 4,
        "title": "Good sound quality",
        "content": "Updated thoughts on these earbuds...",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T10:20:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Cannot edit review):


{
    "message": "You can only edit your own reviews within 30 days of creation."
}

Example response (404, Review not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Review] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/reviews/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: multipart/form-data

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to update. Example: 123

Body Parameters

rating   integer  optional  

optional Updated rating from 1-5 stars. Example: 4

title   string  optional  

optional Updated review title (3-255 characters). Example: "Good sound quality"

content   string  optional  

optional Updated review content (10-2000 characters). Example: "Updated thoughts on these earbuds..."

media   file[]  optional  

optional New media files to add (max 5 total files).

remove_media   integer[]  optional  

optional Array of media IDs to remove.

Delete a review

requires authentication

Delete your own review. This action is irreversible and will also remove all associated media files and helpfulness votes.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Review deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Review deleted successfully."
}

Example response (403, Cannot delete review):


{
    "message": "You can only delete your own reviews."
}

Example response (404, Review not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Review] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to delete. Example: 123

Vote on review helpfulness

requires authentication

Mark a review as helpful or not helpful. Users cannot vote on their own reviews and can only vote once per review (but can change their vote).

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/helpfulness" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"is_helpful\": true
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/helpfulness"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "is_helpful": true
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/helpfulness';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'is_helpful' => true,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/helpfulness'
payload = {
    "is_helpful": true
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Vote recorded successfully):


{
    "message": "Thank you for your feedback!",
    "data": {
        "review_id": 123,
        "helpful_votes": 13,
        "total_votes": 16,
        "helpfulness_ratio": 81.3,
        "user_vote": true
    }
}

Example response (403, Cannot vote on own review):


{
    "message": "You cannot vote on your own review."
}

Example response (409, Already voted):


{
    "message": "You have already voted on this review with the same rating."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/reviews/{review_id}/helpfulness

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

review_id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to vote on. Example: 123

Body Parameters

is_helpful   boolean   

Whether the review was helpful. Example: true

Report an inappropriate review

requires authentication

Report a review for inappropriate content, spam, or other violations. Reported reviews are flagged for admin moderation review.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/report" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"reason\": \"spam\",
    \"details\": \"\\\"This review contains promotional links\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/report"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "reason": "spam",
    "details": "\"This review contains promotional links\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/report';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'reason' => 'spam',
            'details' => '"This review contains promotional links"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/reviews/16/report'
payload = {
    "reason": "spam",
    "details": "\"This review contains promotional links\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Review reported successfully):


{
    "message": "Review reported successfully. Our moderation team will review it shortly.",
    "data": {
        "report_id": 45,
        "review_id": 123,
        "reason": "spam",
        "status": "pending"
    }
}

Example response (403, Cannot report own review):


{
    "message": "You cannot report your own review."
}

Example response (409, Already reported):


{
    "message": "You have already reported this review."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/reviews/{review_id}/report

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

review_id   integer   

The ID of the review. Example: 16

review   integer   

The ID of the review to report. Example: 123

Body Parameters

reason   string   

Reason for reporting. Options: spam, inappropriate_language, fake_review, off_topic, personal_information, other. Example: spam

details   string  optional  

optional Additional details (required if reason is "other"). Example: "This review contains promotional links"

Product Tag Management

Retrieve all product tags

requires authentication

Get a complete list of all product tags in the system. Product tags are used to label and categorize products for better searchability and organization. Tags help customers find products through filtering and search functionality. This endpoint provides administrators with an overview of all available tags and their usage statistics.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product tags retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Tags retrieved successfully.",
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "electronics",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:00:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:00:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "wireless",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:05:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:05:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 3,
            "name": "bluetooth",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:10:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:10:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 4,
            "name": "waterproof",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:15:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:15:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "premium",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:20:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:20:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 6,
            "name": "noise-cancelling",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:25:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:25:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 7,
            "name": "portable",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:30:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:30:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 8,
            "name": "gaming",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T09:35:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T09:35:00.000000Z"
        }
    ]
}

Example response (200, No tags found):


{
    "message": "Tags retrieved successfully.",
    "data": []
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/product-tags

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Create a new product tag

requires authentication

Add a new product tag to the system. Tags should be descriptive, concise, and follow consistent naming conventions (typically lowercase, hyphen-separated for multi-word tags). Once created, tags can be assigned to products to improve searchability and organization. Tag names must be unique across the system.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"wireless-charging\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"wireless-charging\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"wireless-charging"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags'
payload = {
    "name": "\"wireless-charging\""
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product tag created successfully):


{
    "message": "Tag created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 9,
        "name": "wireless-charging",
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The name may not be greater than 255 characters."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Duplicate tag name):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-tags

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

name   string   

The name of the product tag. Should be descriptive and follow naming conventions (lowercase, hyphen-separated). Example: "wireless-charging"

Retrieve a specific product tag

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific product tag including its associated products. This endpoint is useful for examining tag usage and understanding which products are currently tagged with specific labels. Helpful for tag management and optimization.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product tag found with associated products):


{
    "message": "Tag retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 9,
        "name": "wireless-charging",
        "products": [
            {
                "id": 15,
                "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones",
                "price": 7999,
                "price_formatted": "£79.99",
                "created_at": "2025-01-10T14:30:00.000000Z"
            },
            {
                "id": 23,
                "name": "Smartphone Wireless Charger",
                "price": 2999,
                "price_formatted": "£29.99",
                "created_at": "2025-01-12T16:20:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "products_count": 2,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (200, Product tag with no associated products):


{
    "message": "Tag retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 9,
        "name": "wireless-charging",
        "products": [],
        "products_count": 0,
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Product tag not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ProductTag] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:

You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/product-tags/{productTag_id}

Example: application/json

productTag   integer   

The ID of the product tag to retrieve. Example: 9

Update an existing product tag

requires authentication

Modify an existing product tag name. Exercise caution when updating tags as they may be referenced by multiple products and affect search functionality. Ensure that any name changes maintain consistency with existing tagging conventions and don't create confusion for customers or administrators.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"\\\"fast-wireless-charging\\\"\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "\"fast-wireless-charging\""
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => '"fast-wireless-charging"',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

    "name": "\"fast-wireless-charging\""
}

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

    "message": "Tag updated successfully.",

        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:45:00.000000Z"
    }
}

{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

{

}

{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The name may not be greater than 255 characters."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Name already exists):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/product-tags/{productTag_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productTag_id   integer   

The ID of the productTag. Example: 1

productTag   integer   

The ID of the product tag to update. Example: 9

Body Parameters

name   string   

The updated name of the product tag. Must be unique and follow naming conventions. Example: "fast-wireless-charging"

Delete a product tag

requires authentication

Permanently remove a product tag from the system. This action is irreversible and will automatically remove the tag from all products that currently have it assigned. Before deletion, consider the impact on product searchability and organization. Customers may no longer be able to find products using this tag for filtering or search.

Warning: Deleting a widely-used tag may significantly affect product discoverability and customer search experience.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/product-tags/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Product tag deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Tag deleted successfully."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Product tag not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\ProductTag] 999"
}

Example response (409, Tag in use by products):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete product tag that is currently assigned to products. Please remove the tag from all products first."
}

Example response (422, Tag has dependencies):


{
    "message": "This tag is currently being used by active products and cannot be deleted."
}

Example response (500, Deletion failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while deleting the product tag."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/product-tags/{productTag_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

productTag_id   integer   

The ID of the productTag. Example: 1

productTag   integer   

The ID of the product tag to delete. Example: 9

Refund Processing

Process a refund for an approved return through the specified payment gateway

requires authentication

Execute a refund transaction for an approved return request through the specified payment gateway. This endpoint handles the actual refund processing, updates order statuses, and maintains audit trails. Only approved returns can be processed for refunds. The system automatically calculates refund amounts and updates payment statuses accordingly.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds/stripe/15" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds/stripe/15"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds/stripe/15';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/refunds/stripe/15'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Refund processed successfully):


{
    "message": "Refund processed successfully."
}

Example response (400, Unsupported payment gateway):


{
    "message": "Unsupported payment gateway"
}

Example response (400, Return not approved for refund):


{
    "message": "This return has not been approved for refund."
}

Example response (400, Insufficient refundable amount):


{
    "message": "Refund amount exceeds the remaining refundable balance for this order."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Return request not found):


{
    "message": "Return request not found."
}

Example response (404, No payment found for order):


{
    "message": "No valid payment found for this order. Cannot process refund."
}

Example response (409, Refund already processed):


{
    "message": "A refund has already been processed for this return request."
}

Example response (422, Refund failed at gateway):


{
    "message": "Refund failed. Please try again later."
}

Example response (422, Payment intent not found):


{
    "message": "Payment intent not found in payment gateway. Cannot process refund."
}

Example response (422, Order not in refundable state):


{
    "message": "Order is not in a state that allows refunds (must be paid or partially refunded)."
}

Example response (500, Gateway communication error):


{
    "message": "Unable to communicate with payment gateway. Please try again later."
}

Example response (500, Refund processing error):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while processing the refund."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/refunds/{gateway}/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

gateway   string   

The payment gateway to process the refund through. Currently supports: stripe. Example: stripe

id   integer   

The ID of the return request to refund. Must be an approved return. Example: 15

Return Management

Retrieve a paginated list of all return requests

requires authentication

Get a comprehensive list of all return requests in the system with detailed information about customer reasons, order details, product information, and current status. This endpoint is essential for customer service management, return processing workflows, and administrative oversight of the returns process. Includes complete audit trail and customer communication history.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns?page=2&per_page=25&status=Requested&date_from=2025-01-01&date_to=2025-01-31&order_id=8&user_id=3&product_id=12&reason=damaged" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns"
);

const params = {
    "page": "2",
    "per_page": "25",
    "status": "Requested",
    "date_from": "2025-01-01",
    "date_to": "2025-01-31",
    "order_id": "8",
    "user_id": "3",
    "product_id": "12",
    "reason": "damaged",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'page' => '2',
            'per_page' => '25',
            'status' => 'Requested',
            'date_from' => '2025-01-01',
            'date_to' => '2025-01-31',
            'order_id' => '8',
            'user_id' => '3',
            'product_id' => '12',
            'reason' => 'damaged',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns'
params = {
  'page': '2',
  'per_page': '25',
  'status': 'Requested',
  'date_from': '2025-01-01',
  'date_to': '2025-01-31',
  'order_id': '8',
  'user_id': '3',
  'product_id': '12',
  'reason': 'damaged',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

    "message": "Order returns retrieved.",

                        "id": 8,
                        "total_amount": 5998,
                        "total_amount_formatted": "£59.98",

                            "id": 3,

                "status": "Approved",

                        "price": 7999,

                "id": 4,
                "reason": "Wrong size ordered by mistake - need larger size but currently out of stock",
                "status": "Rejected",
                "created_at": "2025-01-12T11:30:00.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-13T14:45:00.000000Z",
                "order_item": {
                    "id": 22,
                    "quantity": 1,
                    "price": 3999,
                    "price_formatted": "£39.99",
                    "product": {
                        "id": 34,
                        "name": "Wireless Mouse",
                        "price": 3999,
                        "price_formatted": "£39.99"
                    },
                    "order": {
                        "id": 7,
                        "total_amount": 3999,
                        "total_amount_formatted": "£39.99",
                        "user": {
                            "id": 12,
                            "name": "David Rodriguez",
                            "email": "david@example.com"
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        ],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 20,
        "total": 89,
        "last_page": 5,
        "from": 1,
        "to": 20,
        "path": "https://yourapi.com/api/v1/admin/returns",
        "first_page_url": "https://yourapi.com/api/v1/admin/returns?page=1",
        "last_page_url": "https://yourapi.com/api/v1/admin/returns?page=5",
        "next_page_url": "https://yourapi.com/api/v1/admin/returns?page=2",
        "prev_page_url": null
    }
}

Example response (200, No return requests found):


{
    "message": "Order returns retrieved.",
    "data": {
        "data": [],
        "current_page": 1,
        "per_page": 20,
        "total": 0,
        "last_page": 1,
        "from": null,
        "to": null
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Invalid filter parameters):


{
    "errors": [
        "The status field must be one of: Requested, Under Review, Approved, Rejected, Return Shipped, Return Received, Completed, Cancelled, Pending.",
        "The date from field must be a valid date in YYYY-MM-DD format.",
        "The order id field must be an integer.",
        "The user id field must be an integer."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/returns

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of returns per page (max 100). Default: 20. Example: 25

status   string  optional  

optional Filter by return status. Available: Requested, Under Review, Approved, Rejected, Return Shipped, Return Received, Completed, Cancelled, Pending. Example: Requested

date_from   string  optional  

optional Filter returns from this date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Example: 2025-01-01

date_to   string  optional  

optional Filter returns to this date (YYYY-MM-DD format). Example: 2025-01-31

order_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter returns by specific order ID. Example: 8

user_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter returns by specific customer ID. Example: 3

product_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter returns by specific product ID. Example: 12

reason   string  optional  

optional Filter by return reason (partial text search). Example: damaged

Review and update the status of a return request

requires authentication

Process a return request by changing its status through the review workflow. This endpoint allows administrators to move returns through different stages: review, approve, or reject. Status changes trigger appropriate notifications to customers and update the order processing workflow. Only returns in appropriate states can be transitioned to prevent invalid workflows.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns/15/approve" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns/15/approve"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns/15/approve';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/returns/15/approve'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Return approved successfully):


{
    "message": "Return status updated to Approved.",
    "data": {
        "id": 15,
        "order_item_id": 25,
        "reason": "Product damaged on arrival - speaker has crackling sound at any volume level",
        "order_return_status_id": 3,
        "created_at": "2025-01-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T14:45:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (200, Return moved to review):


{
    "message": "Return status updated to Under Review.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "order_item_id": 18,
        "reason": "Product does not match description - advertised as waterproof but failed during first use",
        "order_return_status_id": 2,
        "created_at": "2025-01-14T14:20:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T09:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (200, Return rejected):


{
    "message": "Return status updated to Rejected.",
    "data": {
        "id": 8,
        "order_item_id": 22,
        "reason": "Wrong size ordered by mistake",
        "order_return_status_id": 4,
        "created_at": "2025-01-12T11:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T16:15:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (400, Return window expired):


{
    "message": "Return request cannot be approved as the return window has expired."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Return request not found):


{
    "message": "Return request not found."
}

Example response (409, Return already has refund):


{
    "message": "Cannot modify return status as a refund has already been processed for this item."
}

Example response (422, Return already processed):


{
    "message": "Return is already processed."
}

Example response (422, Invalid action provided):


{
    "message": "Invalid action provided."
}

Example response (422, Invalid status transition):


{
    "message": "Cannot change return status from Completed to Under Review. Invalid status transition."
}

Example response (422, Order not eligible for returns):


{
    "message": "Order is not in a state that allows returns (must be delivered or completed)."
}

Example response (500, Status update failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while updating the return status."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/returns/{returnId}/{action}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

returnId   integer   

The ID of the return request to review. Example: 15

action   string   

The action to perform on the return. Must be one of: review, approve, reject. Example: approve

Role Management

Retrieve all user roles

requires authentication

Get a complete list of all user roles in the system. Roles define user access levels and permissions within the application. This endpoint is essential for user management, access control configuration, and understanding the system's permission structure. Only administrators with proper permissions can view roles to maintain system security.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

    "message": "Roles retrieved successfully.",

            "id": 1,

            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:00:00.000000Z"

            "id": 2,
            "name": "admin",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:05:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:05:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 3,
            "name": "manager",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:10:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:10:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 4,
            "name": "customer_service",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:15:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:15:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "vendor",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:20:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:20:00.000000Z"
        },
        {
            "id": 6,
            "name": "user",
            "created_at": "2024-12-01T08:25:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2024-12-01T08:25:00.000000Z"
        }
    ]
}

Example response (200, No roles configured):


{
    "message": "Roles retrieved successfully.",
    "data": []
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}
