Request      

GET api/admin/roles

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Create a new user role

requires authentication

Add a new role to the system for user access control. Roles define what permissions users have and what actions they can perform within the application. Role names should follow a consistent naming convention (lowercase, underscore-separated) and must be unique. Once created, roles can be assigned to users and configured with specific permissions.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"customer_service\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "customer_service"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => 'customer_service',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles'
payload = {
    "name": "customer_service"
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Role created successfully):


{
    "message": "Role created successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 7,
        "name": "customer_service",
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The name may not be greater than 255 characters."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Duplicate role name):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/roles

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

name   string   

The name of the role. Should follow naming convention (lowercase, underscore-separated). Will be converted to lowercase automatically. Example: customer_service

Update an existing role

requires authentication

Modify an existing role name in the system. Exercise caution when updating roles as this may affect user access throughout the application. Ensure that any name changes are reflected in user assignments and access control logic. Role names are automatically converted to lowercase and must remain unique across all roles.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"senior_customer_service\"
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "senior_customer_service"
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => 'senior_customer_service',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9'
payload = {
    "name": "senior_customer_service"
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

{
    "message": "Role updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 7,
        "name": "senior_customer_service",
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:15:00.000000Z"
    }
}

{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Role not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Role] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name field is required.",
        "The name has already been taken.",
        "The name may not be greater than 255 characters."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Name already exists):


{
    "errors": [
        "The name has already been taken."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/roles/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the role. Example: 9

role   integer   

The ID of the role to update. Example: 7

Body Parameters

name   string   

The updated name of the role. Should follow naming convention (lowercase, underscore-separated). Will be converted to lowercase automatically. Example: senior_customer_service

Delete a role

requires authentication

Permanently remove a role from the system. This action is irreversible and will affect all users currently assigned to this role. Before deletion, ensure that users with this role are reassigned to appropriate alternative roles to maintain proper access control. Exercise extreme caution when deleting roles as this may impact user access throughout the application.

Warning: Deleting a role that is currently assigned to users may leave those users without proper access permissions, potentially locking them out of system features.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Role deleted successfully):


{
    "message": "Role deleted successfully."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Role not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Role] 999"
}

Example response (409, Role in use by users):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete role that is currently assigned to users."
}

Example response (422, Core role protection):


{
    "message": "Cannot delete core system roles required for application functionality."
}

Example response (500, Deletion failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while deleting the role."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the role. Example: 9

role   integer   

The ID of the role to delete. Example: 7

Role Permission Management

Retrieve all permissions for a specific role

requires authentication

Get a complete list of permissions assigned to a specific role. This endpoint is essential for understanding what actions users with this role can perform within the system. It provides administrators with visibility into the current permission structure and helps with access control auditing and role management decisions.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Permissions retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Permissions retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "manager",
        "permissions": [
            "view_users",
            "create_users",
            "edit_users",
            "view_orders",
            "create_orders",
            "edit_orders",
            "view_products",
            "create_products",
            "edit_products",
            "view_vendors",
            "manage_returns",
            "view_payments"
        ]
    }
}

Example response (200, Role with no permissions):


{
    "message": "Permissions retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "new_role",
        "permissions": []
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Role not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Role] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/admin/roles/{role_id}/permissions

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

role_id   integer   

The ID of the role. Example: 9

role   integer   

The ID of the role to retrieve permissions for. Example: 3

Assign specific permissions to a role

requires authentication

Grant specific permissions to a role, enabling users with that role to perform the associated actions. This endpoint allows fine-grained control over role capabilities by selectively assigning permissions. Permissions are added to existing ones (not replaced), so you can incrementally build up role permissions without losing previously assigned ones.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"permissions\": [
        \"architecto\"
    ]
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "permissions": [
        "architecto"
    ]
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'permissions' => [
                'architecto',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions'
payload = {
    "permissions": [
        "architecto"
    ]
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Permissions assigned successfully):


{
    "message": "Permissions assigned successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "manager",
        "assigned_permissions": [
            "delete_users",
            "manage_refunds",
            "view_reports"
        ],
        "total_permissions": 15
    }
}

Example response (200, Permissions already assigned):


{
    "message": "Permissions assigned successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "manager",
        "assigned_permissions": [],
        "note": "All specified permissions were already assigned to this role",
        "total_permissions": 12
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Role not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Role] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The permissions field is required.",
        "The permissions must be an array.",
        "The permissions.0 is invalid. Permission 'invalid_permission' does not exist.",
        "The permissions.1 is invalid. Permission 'another_invalid' does not exist."
    ]
}

Example response (422, Invalid permission names):


{
    "errors": [
        "The following permissions do not exist: invalid_permission, fake_permission"
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/roles/{role_id}/permissions

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

role_id   integer   

The ID of the role. Example: 9

role   integer   

The ID of the role to assign permissions to. Example: 3

Body Parameters

permissions   string[]   

List of permission names to assign to the role. All permission names must exist in the system.
*   string   

The name of each permission to assign. Must be exact permission names as stored in the database. Example: "view_users"

Assign all available permissions to a role

requires authentication

Grant all permissions in the system to a specific role, effectively creating a "super" role with complete access to all system functionality. Use this endpoint with extreme caution as it provides unrestricted access to all features. This is typically used for super administrator roles or during initial system setup. The operation will assign every permission that exists in the system.

Warning: This gives complete system access to users with this role. Ensure this is intentional and that the role is assigned only to trusted administrators.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions/assign-all" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions/assign-all"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions/assign-all';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions/assign-all'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, All permissions assigned successfully):


{
    "message": "All permissions assigned successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "super_admin",
        "total_permissions_assigned": 47,
        "newly_assigned": 12,
        "already_assigned": 35,
        "permissions": [
            "view_users",
            "create_users",
            "edit_users",
            "delete_users",
            "view_orders",
            "create_orders",
            "edit_orders",
            "delete_orders",
            "view_products",
            "create_products",
            "edit_products",
            "delete_products",
            "view_vendors",
            "create_vendors",
            "edit_vendors",
            "delete_vendors",
            "view_payments",
            "manage_refunds",
            "manage_returns",
            "view_roles",
            "create_roles",
            "edit_roles",
            "delete_roles",
            "view_permissions",
            "create_permissions",
            "edit_permissions",
            "delete_permissions",
            "view_reports",
            "export_data",
            "import_data",
            "system_settings",
            "user_management",
            "security_settings"
        ]
    }
}

Example response (200, Role already has all permissions):


{
    "message": "All permissions assigned successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "super_admin",
        "total_permissions_assigned": 47,
        "newly_assigned": 0,
        "already_assigned": 47,
        "note": "Role already had all available permissions"
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Role not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Role] 999"
}

Example response (500, Assignment failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while assigning all permissions to the role."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/admin/roles/{role_id}/permissions/assign-all

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

role_id   integer   

The ID of the role. Example: 9

role   integer   

The ID of the role to assign all permissions to. Example: 1

Revoke a specific permission from a role

requires authentication

Remove a specific permission from a role, preventing users with that role from performing the associated action. This endpoint provides fine-grained control over role capabilities by allowing selective removal of permissions. Use this when you need to restrict access to specific features for users with a particular role while maintaining their other permissions.

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions/61" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions/61"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions/61';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/admin/roles/9/permissions/61'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Permission revoked successfully):


{
    "message": "Permission revoked successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "manager",
        "revoked_permission": "delete_users",
        "remaining_permissions_count": 11,
        "remaining_permissions": [
            "view_users",
            "create_users",
            "edit_users",
            "view_orders",
            "create_orders",
            "edit_orders",
            "view_products",
            "create_products",
            "edit_products",
            "view_vendors",
            "manage_returns"
        ]
    }
}

Example response (200, Permission was not assigned):


{
    "message": "Permission revoked successfully.",
    "data": {
        "role": "manager",
        "permission": "super_admin_only",
        "note": "Permission was not assigned to this role",
        "remaining_permissions_count": 12
    }
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, Role not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Role] 999"
}

Example response (404, Permission not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\Permission] 999"
}

Example response (422, Cannot revoke core permission):


{
    "message": "Cannot revoke core system permissions that are required for role functionality."
}

Example response (500, Revocation failed):


{
    "message": "An error occurred while revoking the permission from the role."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/admin/roles/{role_id}/permissions/{permission_id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

role_id   integer   

The ID of the role. Example: 9

permission_id   integer   

The ID of the permission. Example: 61

role   integer   

The ID of the role to revoke the permission from. Example: 3

permission   integer   

The ID of the permission to revoke from the role. Example: 12

Shopping Cart

Retrieve user's shopping cart

requires authentication

Get the current cart contents for the authenticated user. Returns cart items with product details, pricing information, availability status, and total calculations. Requires a valid authentication token (Laravel Passport).

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/cart" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

    "message": "Cart retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,

        "is_expired": false,
        "is_empty": false,
        "items": [
            {
                "id": 45,
                "product_id": 15,
                "product_variant_id": 24,
                "quantity": 2,
                "price_snapshot": 7999,
                "price_formatted": "£79.99",
                "line_total": 15998,
                "line_total_formatted": "£159.98",
                "current_price": 7999,
                "has_price_changed": false,
                "is_available": true,
                "available_stock": 20,
                "product": {
                    "id": 15,
                    "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones",
                    "description": "Premium quality wireless headphones",
                    "price": 7499,
                    "price_formatted": "£74.99",
                    "featured_image": "https://yourapi.com/storage/products/headphones.jpg",

                },
                "product_variant": {
                    "id": 24,
                    "value": "White",
                    "additional_price": 500,
                    "additional_price_formatted": "£5.00",
                    "quantity": 20,
                    "product_attribute": {
                        "id": 1,
                        "name": "Color"
                    }
                },
                "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
                "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:35:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (200, Empty cart):


{
    "message": "Cart retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 13,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 0,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£0.00",
        "total_items_count": 0,
        "expires_at": null,
        "is_expired": false,
        "is_empty": true,
        "items": [],
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (401, Authentication required):


{
    "message": "Authentication required for cart operations."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/cart

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Add item to shopping cart

requires authentication

Add a product (with optional variant) to the authenticated user's shopping cart. If the item already exists, the quantities will be combined. Validates product availability, stock levels, and pricing. Requires a valid authentication token (Laravel Passport).

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"product_id\": 15,
    \"product_variant_id\": 24,
    \"quantity\": 2
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "product_id": 15,
    "product_variant_id": 24,
    "quantity": 2
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'product_id' => 15,
            'product_variant_id' => 24,
            'quantity' => 2,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items'
payload = {
    "product_id": 15,
    "product_variant_id": 24,
    "quantity": 2
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Item added successfully):


{
    "message": "Item added to cart successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 15998,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£159.98",
        "total_items_count": 2,
        "expires_at": null,
        "is_expired": false,
        "is_empty": false,
        "items": [
            {
                "id": 45,
                "product_id": 15,
                "product_variant_id": 24,
                "quantity": 2,
                "price_snapshot": 7999,
                "price_formatted": "£79.99",
                "line_total": 15998,
                "line_total_formatted": "£159.98",
                "current_price": 7999,
                "has_price_changed": false,
                "is_available": true,
                "available_stock": 18,
                "product": {
                    "id": 15,
                    "name": "Wireless Bluetooth Headphones",
                    "status": "Active"
                },
                "product_variant": {
                    "id": 24,
                    "value": "White",
                    "additional_price": 500,
                    "quantity": 18
                }
            }
        ]
    }
}

Example response (400, Product not available):


{
    "message": "Product is not available for purchase."
}

Example response (400, Insufficient stock):


{
    "message": "Insufficient stock. Only 5 items available."
}

Example response (401, Authentication required):


{
    "message": "Authentication required for cart operations."
}

Example response (404, Product not found):


{
    "message": "The selected product is not available."
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "Please select a product to add to cart.",
        "Quantity must be at least 1.",
        "The selected product variant does not belong to the specified product."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/cart/items

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

product_id   integer   

The ID of the product to add to cart. Example: 15

product_variant_id   integer  optional  

optional The ID of the product variant (for products with variants like color, size). Example: 24

quantity   integer   

The quantity to add to cart (1-999). Example: 2

Update cart item quantity

requires authentication

Update the quantity of a specific item in the authenticated user's cart. Setting quantity to 0 will remove the item from the cart. Validates stock availability and updates pricing to current product price if it has changed since adding to cart. Requires a valid authentication token (Laravel Passport).

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"quantity\": 3
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "quantity": 3
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'quantity' => 3,
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45'
payload = {
    "quantity": 3
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Cart item updated successfully):


{
    "message": "Cart updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 23997,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£239.97",
        "total_items_count": 3,
        "expires_at": null,
        "is_expired": false,
        "is_empty": false,
        "items": [
            {
                "id": 45,
                "product_id": 15,
                "product_variant_id": 24,
                "quantity": 3,
                "price_snapshot": 7999,
                "price_formatted": "£79.99",
                "line_total": 23997,
                "line_total_formatted": "£239.97",
                "current_price": 7999,
                "has_price_changed": false,
                "is_available": true,
                "available_stock": 17
            }
        ]
    }
}

Example response (200, Item removed (quantity set to 0)):


{
    "message": "Cart updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 0,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£0.00",
        "total_items_count": 0,
        "expires_at": null,
        "is_empty": true,
        "items": []
    }
}

Example response (400, Insufficient stock):


{
    "message": "Insufficient stock. Only 2 items available."
}

Example response (401, Authentication required):


{
    "message": "Authentication required for cart operations."
}

Example response (404, Cart item not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\CartItem] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "Please specify the quantity.",
        "Cannot have more than 999 items of the same product."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/cart/items/{cartItem}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

cartItem   integer   

The ID of the cart item to update. Example: 45

Body Parameters

quantity   integer   

The new quantity for the cart item (0 to remove). Example: 3

Remove item from cart

requires authentication

Remove a specific item completely from the authenticated user's shopping cart. This action cannot be undone. The cart totals and item count will be automatically recalculated. Requires a valid authentication token (Laravel Passport).

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/items/45'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Item removed successfully):


{
    "message": "Item removed from cart successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 7999,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£79.99",
        "total_items_count": 1,
        "expires_at": null,
        "is_expired": false,
        "is_empty": false,
        "items": [
            {
                "id": 46,
                "product_id": 22,
                "quantity": 1,
                "line_total": 7999,
                "line_total_formatted": "£79.99"
            }
        ]
    }
}

Example response (401, Authentication required):


{
    "message": "Authentication required for cart operations."
}

Example response (404, Cart item not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\CartItem] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/cart/items/{cartItem}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

cartItem   integer   

The ID of the cart item to remove. Example: 45

Clear entire cart

requires authentication

Remove all items from the authenticated user's shopping cart. This action cannot be undone and will result in an empty cart. Useful for starting over or clearing expired/unavailable items. Requires a valid authentication token (Laravel Passport).

Example request:
curl --request DELETE \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/clear" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/clear"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "DELETE",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/clear';
$response = $client->delete(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/clear'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('DELETE', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Cart cleared successfully):


{
    "message": "Cart cleared successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 0,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£0.00",
        "total_items_count": 0,
        "expires_at": null,
        "is_expired": false,
        "is_empty": true,
        "items": [],
        "created_at": "2025-01-16T14:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T14:45:00.000000Z"
    }
}

Example response (401, Authentication required):


{
    "message": "Authentication required for cart operations."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

DELETE api/cart/clear

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Synchronize cart prices

requires authentication

Update all cart item prices for the authenticated user to match current product prices. This is useful when product prices have changed since items were added to the cart. Returns information about which items had price changes. Requires a valid authentication token (Laravel Passport).

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/sync-prices" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/cart/sync-prices"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/sync-prices';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/cart/sync-prices'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Prices synchronized successfully):


{
    "message": "Cart prices synchronized. 2 items updated.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 17998,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£179.98",
        "total_items_count": 2,
        "expires_at": null,
        "items": [
            {
                "id": 45,
                "product_id": 15,
                "quantity": 2,
                "price_snapshot": 8999,
                "price_formatted": "£89.99",
                "line_total": 17998,
                "line_total_formatted": "£179.98",
                "current_price": 8999,
                "has_price_changed": false,
                "price_change": 1000
            }
        ]
    }
}

Example response (200, No price changes):


{
    "message": "Cart prices synchronized. 0 items updated.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "user_id": 123,
        "total_amount": 15998,
        "total_amount_formatted": "£159.98",
        "expires_at": null,
        "items": []
    }
}

Example response (401, Authentication required):


{
    "message": "Authentication required for cart operations."
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/cart/sync-prices

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

User Orders

Retrieve user's orders

requires authentication

Get a paginated list of orders for the authenticated user. This endpoint allows users to view their order history with optional filtering by status. Orders include complete information about items purchased, payment status, delivery details, and current order status. Users can only access their own orders for privacy and security.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/orders?user_id=123&status_id=2&page=2&per_page=10" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/orders"
);

const params = {
    "user_id": "123",
    "status_id": "2",
    "page": "2",
    "per_page": "10",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/orders';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'user_id' => '123',
            'status_id' => '2',
            'page' => '2',
            'per_page' => '10',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/orders'
params = {
  'user_id': '123',
  'status_id': '2',
  'page': '2',
  'per_page': '10',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()

    "data": {
        "data": [],

        "total": 0,
        "last_page": 1,
        "from": null,
        "to": null
    }
}

{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

    "message": "You can only access your own orders."
}

{
    "errors": [
        "The user id must be an integer.",
        "The status id must exist in order_statuses table."
    ]
}

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/orders

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

user_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter orders by user ID (must match authenticated user). Example: 123

status_id   integer  optional  

optional Filter orders by specific status ID. See order statuses endpoint for available options. Example: 2

page   integer  optional  

optional Page number for pagination. Default: 1. Example: 2

per_page   integer  optional  

optional Number of orders per page (max 50). Default: 15. Example: 10

Body Parameters

user_id   string  optional  

The id of an existing record in the users table.

status_id   string  optional  

The id of an existing record in the order_statuses table.

Retrieve a specific order

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific order belonging to the authenticated user. This includes complete order details, all purchased items with product information, payment records, shipping status, and any returns or refunds. Users can only access their own orders. This endpoint is perfect for order confirmation pages and order tracking.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/orders/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/orders/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/orders/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/orders/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

{
    "message": "You can only access your own orders."

If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/orders/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the order. Example: 1

order   integer   

The ID of the order to retrieve. Must belong to the authenticated user. Example: 45

User Profile

Retrieve user profile information

requires authentication

Get detailed profile information for a specific user. Users can view their own complete profile including personal details, address information, security settings, and account status. Other authenticated users can only view basic public profile information for privacy protection. This endpoint is commonly used for profile pages and account management interfaces.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/users/76" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/users/76"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/users/76';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/users/76'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Own profile retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "User details retrieved.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "name": "Sarah Johnson",
        "email": "sarah.johnson@example.com",
        "email_verified_at": "2025-01-10T08:00:00.000000Z",
        "stripe_customer_id": "cus_1234567890abcdef",
        "password_changed_at": "2025-01-01T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "last_login_at": "2025-01-16T09:15:00.000000Z",
        "last_login_ip": "192.168.1.100",
        "created_at": "2024-12-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T09:15:00.000000Z",
        "deleted_at": null,
        "user_address": {
            "id": 45,
            "address_line1": "123 Oak Street",
            "address_line2": "Apartment 4B",
            "city": "London",
            "state": "England",
            "country": "United Kingdom",
            "postal_code": "SW1A 1AA"
        },
        "role": {
            "id": 7,
            "name": "User"
        },
        "vendors": [
            {
                "id": 12,
                "name": "Sarah's Boutique",
                "description": "Handcrafted jewelry and accessories",
                "logo": "https://yourapi.com/storage/vendor-logos/sarahs-boutique.jpg",
                "created_at": "2025-01-05T14:20:00.000000Z"
            }
        ],
        "security_info": {
            "requires_password_change": false,
            "days_until_password_expiry": 45,
            "security_score": {
                "score": 85,
                "level": "good",
                "issues": [
                    "Consider enabling two-factor authentication"
                ]
            },
            "is_account_locked": false
        }
    }
}

Example response (200, Other user's public profile):


{
    "message": "User details retrieved.",
    "data": {
        "id": 456,
        "name": "John Smith",
        "email": "j***@example.com",
        "email_verified_at": "2025-01-08T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "created_at": "2024-11-20T16:45:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T11:30:00.000000Z",
        "role": {
            "id": 7,
            "name": "User"
        },
        "vendors": []
    }
}

Example response (401, User not authenticated):


{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, User not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\User] 999"
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/users/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the user. Example: 76

user   integer   

The ID of the user whose profile to retrieve. Example: 123

Update user profile information

requires authentication

Update the authenticated user's profile information including personal details and address. Users can only update their own profiles for security reasons. This endpoint supports partial updates - only provided fields will be updated, others remain unchanged. Password updates require the current password for security verification.

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://marketplace.com/api/users/76" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"name\": \"Sarah Jane Johnson\",
    \"email\": \"sarah.johnson.new@example.com\",
    \"password\": \"MyNewSecurePassword123!\",
    \"role_id\": 7,
    \"address\": {
        \"address_line1\": \"456 Maple Avenue\",
        \"city\": \"Manchester\",
        \"country\": \"United Kingdom\",
        \"postal_code\": \"M1 1AA\",
        \"address_line2\": \"Suite 201\",
        \"state\": \"Greater Manchester\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/users/76"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "name": "Sarah Jane Johnson",
    "email": "sarah.johnson.new@example.com",
    "password": "MyNewSecurePassword123!",
    "role_id": 7,
    "address": {
        "address_line1": "456 Maple Avenue",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "country": "United Kingdom",
        "postal_code": "M1 1AA",
        "address_line2": "Suite 201",
        "state": "Greater Manchester"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/users/76';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'name' => 'Sarah Jane Johnson',
            'email' => 'sarah.johnson.new@example.com',
            'password' => 'MyNewSecurePassword123!',
            'role_id' => 7,
            'address' => [
                'address_line1' => '456 Maple Avenue',
                'city' => 'Manchester',
                'country' => 'United Kingdom',
                'postal_code' => 'M1 1AA',
                'address_line2' => 'Suite 201',
                'state' => 'Greater Manchester',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/users/76'
payload = {
    "name": "Sarah Jane Johnson",
    "email": "sarah.johnson.new@example.com",
    "password": "MyNewSecurePassword123!",
    "role_id": 7,
    "address": {
        "address_line1": "456 Maple Avenue",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "country": "United Kingdom",
        "postal_code": "M1 1AA",
        "address_line2": "Suite 201",
        "state": "Greater Manchester"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (200, Profile updated successfully):


{
    "message": "User updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "name": "Sarah Jane Johnson",
        "email": "sarah.johnson.new@example.com",
        "email_verified_at": "2025-01-10T08:00:00.000000Z",
        "stripe_customer_id": "cus_1234567890abcdef",
        "password_changed_at": "2025-01-01T12:00:00.000000Z",
        "last_login_at": "2025-01-16T09:15:00.000000Z",
        "last_login_ip": "192.168.1.100",
        "created_at": "2024-12-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-16T15:22:00.000000Z",
        "deleted_at": null,
        "user_address": {
            "id": 45,
            "address_line1": "456 Maple Avenue",
            "address_line2": "Suite 201",
            "city": "Manchester",
            "state": "Greater Manchester",
            "country": "United Kingdom",
            "postal_code": "M1 1AA"
        },
        "role": {
            "id": 7,
            "name": "User"
        },
        "vendors": [
            {
                "id": 12,
                "name": "Sarah's Boutique",
                "description": "Handcrafted jewelry and accessories",
                "logo": "https://yourapi.com/storage/vendor-logos/sarahs-boutique.jpg"
            }
        ],
        "security_info": {
            "requires_password_change": false,
            "days_until_password_expiry": 45,
            "security_score": {
                "score": 85,
                "level": "good",
                "issues": [
                    "Consider enabling two-factor authentication"
                ]
            },
            "is_account_locked": false
        }
    }
}

Example response (200, Address created for first time):


{
    "message": "User updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "id": 123,
        "name": "Sarah Johnson",
        "email": "sarah.johnson@example.com",
        "user_address": {
            "id": 67,
            "address_line1": "789 Pine Street",
            "address_line2": null,
            "city": "Edinburgh",
            "state": "Scotland",
            "country": "United Kingdom",
            "postal_code": "EH1 1YZ"
        }
    }
}

Example response (400, Email verification required):


{
    "message": "Email verification required after email change. Please check your new email for verification link."
}

Example response (401, User not authenticated):


{
    "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

Example response (403, Cannot update other user's profile):


{
    "message": "You can only update your own profile."
}

Example response (403, Insufficient permissions for role change):


{
    "message": "You do not have the required permissions."
}

Example response (404, User not found):


{
    "message": "No query results for model [App\\Models\\User] 999"
}

Example response (422, Validation errors):


{
    "errors": [
        "The email has already been taken.",
        "The password must be at least 8 characters.",
        "The address.address_line1 field is required when address is present.",
        "The address.city field is required when address is present.",
        "The address.country field is required when address is present.",
        "The address.postal_code field is required when address is present."
    ]
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/users/{id}

Headers

Authorization      

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}

Content-Type      

Example: application/json

Accept      

Example: application/json

URL Parameters

id   integer   

The ID of the user. Example: 76

user   integer   

The ID of the user to update. Must match the authenticated user's ID. Example: 123

Body Parameters

name   string  optional  

optional The user's full name. Will be automatically formatted with proper capitalization. Example: Sarah Jane Johnson

email   string  optional  

optional The user's email address. Must be unique across all users. Example: sarah.johnson.new@example.com

password   string  optional  

optional New password. Must be at least 8 characters. Requires current password verification via separate endpoint. Example: MyNewSecurePassword123!

role_id   integer  optional  

optional The user's role ID. Only admins can change user roles. Example: 7

address   object  optional  

optional Complete address information for shipping and billing.
address_line1   string   

Primary address line. Example: 456 Maple Avenue

city   string   

City name. Example: Manchester

country   string   

Country name. Example: United Kingdom

postal_code   string   

Postal or ZIP code. Example: M1 1AA

address_line2   string  optional  

optional Secondary address line (apartment, suite, etc.). Example: Suite 201

state   string  optional  

optional State or region. Example: Greater Manchester

Vendor Profile

Retrieve a specific vendor profile

requires authentication

Get detailed information about a specific vendor including their profile details, logo, and media. This endpoint is typically used for vendor profile pages and allows authenticated users to view vendor information. Vendors can view their own complete profile, while other users may see limited public information depending on privacy settings.

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://marketplace.com/api/vendors/1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://marketplace.com/api/vendors/1"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendors/1';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://marketplace.com/api/vendors/1'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()

Example response (200, Vendor profile retrieved successfully):


{
    "message": "Vendor details retrieved.",
    "data": {
        "id": 12,
        "name": "TechCraft Solutions",
        "description": "Innovative technology solutions for modern businesses. We specialize in custom software development, cloud services, and digital transformation consulting.",
        "user": {
            "id": 45,
            "name": "Sarah Mitchell",
            "email": "sarah@techcraft.com",
            "email_verified_at": "2025-01-10T08:00:00.000000Z",
            "created_at": "2024-12-15T10:30:00.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2025-01-16T09:15:00.000000Z"
        },
        "logo": "https://yourapi.com/storage/vendor-logos/techcraft-logo.jpg",
        "media": [
            {
                "id": 78,
                "url": "https://yourapi.com/storage/vendor-logos/techcraft-logo.jpg",
                "name": "TechCraft Logo",
                "file_name": "techcraft-logo.jpg",
                "mime_type": "image/jpeg",
                "size": 156789
            }
        ],
        "products_count": 23,
        "created_at": "2025-01-05T14:20:00.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-01-15T16:45:00.000000Z",
        "deleted_at": null
    }
}

        "user": {
            "id": 23,
            "name": "Alex Johnson",
            "email": "alex@startup-innovations.com",
            "email_verified_at": "2025-01-14T10:00:00.000000Z"

        "media": [],
        "products_count": 0,
